channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023090955
item.description:
Report X-2023090955

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME TO QA LEAKING. UPON CLOSER INSPECTION FOUND THAT THE PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD LOOSE CAPS AND NO INNER PACKING. ALL EXCESS LIQUID ABSORBED BY THE BOX. BOX DRUMMED AND SENT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN TOTE AND SENT TO QA

item.title: Report X-2023090942
item.description:
Report X-2023090942

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking, removed from sortation, and brought to QA. DescribePack: Cap was not unscrewed, however it had totally popped out of the container. No inner packing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in spill bin and brought to appropriate damage processing area.

item.title: Report X-2023071246
item.description:
Report X-2023071246

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T00:34:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: KLAMATH FALLS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 18th, 2023 the CBTX 742401 was found leaking vapor pressure through the vacuum relief valve. The leak was identified by ODOT Hazmat Inspector C Kuenzi. The car was isolated for safe inspection by a BNSF contractor. Inspection confirmed that vapor was releasing through the VRV. Responders attempted to vent the car and remove the VRV to put a plug in its place to secure the release. The threaded VRV was unable to be removed by responders. In consultation with the shipper, it was determined to clean and purge the car and ship to shop for repair under an OTMA. An inspection can be performed at that time to determine the cause of release through the VRV. There was no cleanup as all vapor dissipated. Release estimates are based upon observations of the responders.
